verses.verse: Call <WH7121> now, <WH4994> if there be any that will answer <WH6030> you; and to which <WH4310> of the saints <WH6918> will you turn? <WH6437>
For wrath <WH3708> kills <WH2026> the foolish <WH191> man, and envy <WH7068> slays <WH4191> the silly <WH6601> one.
I have seen <WH7200> the foolish <WH191> taking root: <WH8327> but suddenly <WH6597> I cursed <WH5344> his habitation. <WH5116>
His children <WH1121> are far <WH7350> from safety, <WH3468> and they are crushed <WH1792> in the gate, <WH8179> neither <WH369> is there any to deliver <WH5337> them.
Whose <WH834> harvest <WH7105> the hungry <WH7456> eats <WH398> up, and takes <WH3947> it even out of the thorns, <WH6791> and the robber <WH6782> swallows <WH7602> up their substance. <WH2428>
Although <WH3588> affliction <WH205> comes <WH3318> not forth <WH3318> of the dust, <WH6083> neither <WH3808> does trouble <WH5999> spring <WH6779> out of the ground; <WH127>
Yet <WH3588> man <WH120> is born <WH3205> to trouble, <WH5999> as the sparks <WH1121> <WH7565> fly <WH5774> upward. <WH1361>
I would seek <WH1875> to God, <WH410> and to God <WH430> would I commit <WH7760> my cause: <WH1700>
Which does <WH6213> great <WH1419> things and unsearchable; <WH369> <WH2714> marvelous <WH6381> things without <WH5704> <WH369> number: <WH4557>
Who gives <WH5414> rain <WH4306> on the earth, <WH776> and sends <WH7971> waters <WH4325> on the fields: <WH2351>
To set <WH7760> up on high <WH4791> those that be low; <WH8217> that those which mourn <WH6937> may be exalted <WH7682> to safety. <WH3468>
He disappoints <WH6565> the devices <WH4284> of the crafty, <WH6175> so that their hands <WH3027> cannot <WH3808> <WH3201> perform their enterprise. <WH8454>
He takes <WH3920> the wise <WH2450> in their own craftiness: <WH6193> and the counsel <WH6098> of the fraudulent <WH6617> is carried <WH4116> headlong.
They meet <WH6298> with darkness <WH2822> in the day time, <WH3119> and grope <WH4959> in the noonday <WH6672> as in the night. <WH3915>
But he saves <WH3467> the poor <WH34> from the sword, <WH2719> from their mouth, <WH6310> and from the hand <WH3027> of the mighty. <WH2389>
So the poor <WH1800> has <WH1961> hope, <WH8615> and iniquity <WH5766> stops <WH7092> her mouth. <WH6310>
Behold, <WH2009> happy <WH835> is the man <WH582> whom God <WH433> corrects: <WH3198> therefore despise <WH3988> not you the chastening <WH4148> of the Almighty: <WH7706>
For he makes sore, <WH3510> and binds <WH2280> up: he wounds, <WH4272> and his hands <WH3027> make whole. <WH7495>
He shall deliver <WH5337> you in six <WH8337> troubles: <WH6869> yes, in seven <WH7651> there shall no <WH3808> evil <WH7451> touch <WH5060> you.
In famine <WH7458> he shall redeem <WH6299> you from death: <WH4194> and in war <WH4421> from the power <WH3027> of the sword. <WH2719>
You shall be hid <WH2244> from the whip <WH7752> of the tongue: <WH3956> neither <WH3808> shall you be afraid <WH3372> of destruction <WH7701> when <WH3588> it comes. <WH935>
At destruction <WH7701> and famine <WH3720> you shall laugh: <WH7832> neither <WH408> shall you be afraid <WH3372> of the beasts <WH2416> of the earth. <WH776>
For you shall be in league <WH1285> with the stones <WH68> of the field: <WH7704> and the beasts <WH2416> of the field <WH7704> shall be at peace <WH7999> with you.
And you shall know <WH3045> that your tabernacle <WH168> shall be in peace; <WH7965> and you shall visit <WH6485> your habitation, <WH5116> and shall not sin. <WH2398>
You shall know <WH3045> also that your seed <WH2233> shall be great, <WH7227> and your offspring <WH6631> as the grass <WH6212> of the earth. <WH776>
You shall come <WH935> to your grave <WH6913> in a full <WH3624> age, <WH3624> like as a shock <WH1430> of corn comes <WH5927> in in his season. <WH6256>
See <WH2009> this, <WH2063> we have searched <WH2713> it, so <WH3651> it is; hear <WH8085> it, and know <WH3045> you it for your good. <WH2896>
